doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia

Relocated & reassembled buildings--Tavern moved from Buck Mountain Road, Rt 665 A Rt 667, East of Free Union, by Mrs. Mark (Josephine) Henderson 1927-28--Interior woodwork from Colle--Log Slave Quarters from Monticello?--Sowell House from Rt 20S--Meadow Run Grist Mill from Shenandoah Valley--Architect Milton Griggs Office after he married the 2nd owner (1932), Mrs Vestal ThoMutual Assurance Society Insurance Policy%Meredith W D Jones Tavern

2 Story Frame, Exterior Tap Room, 2 Tier Porch with Chamfered Posts with Lambs Tongues, Porch Bench, Flush Beaded Porch Panels, Interesting Mantels, Wood Wainscots, Candlestick Moldings, Wall of Troy Moldings, Lambs Tongue Moldings, Pitsaw Marks, Reciprocating Saw Marks, Transom, 6 Panel Door, HL Hinges, 9/6, 9/9, Blinds, Log Slave Quarters, Ghost
survey data: Virginia Landmarks Register--Virginia Road Traces
Michie Tavern¶still image¶1770/1932¶Grigg, Milton L. (Milton LaTour), 1905-1982
